channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 NPR - For Personal Use Only

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: Does Studying Economics Make You Selfish?
item.description: February 21, 2017 - Social science research finds that students who are taught classical economics about how humans act in their rational self-interest, become more likely to act selfishly after learning those lessons.
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - Social science research finds that students who are taught classical economics about how humans act in their rational self-interest, become more likely to act selfishly after learning those lessons. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/21/516375434/does-studying-economics-make-you-selfish

item.title: The Next Pandemic Could Be Dripping On Your Head
item.description: February 21, 2017 - Bats, birds and tourists love a good cave. And so do viruses. Scientists say this mixture could trigger a deadly outbreak.
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - Bats, birds and tourists love a good cave. And so do viruses. Scientists say this mixture could trigger a deadly outbreak. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/02/21/508060742/the-next-pandemic-could-be-dripping-on-your-head

item.title: On the Knife's Edge: Using Therapy To Address Violence Among Teens
item.description: February 21, 2017 - We hear a lot about senseless violence: people who lose their lives or their freedom over a stolen backpack, or perceived slight. Two researchers think social science might help prevent these crimes.
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - We hear a lot about senseless violence: people who lose their lives or their freedom over a stolen backpack, or perceived slight. Two researchers think social science might help prevent these crimes. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/21/512035150/on-the-knifes-edge-using-therapy-to-address-violence-among-teens

item.title: New Research Shows How 'Atmospheric Rivers' Wreak Havoc Around The Globe
item.description: February 20, 2017 - The idea of plumes of moisture curling above our heads might seem beautiful, but new research shows atmospheric rivers to be among the most damaging of weather systems.
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - The idea of plumes of moisture curling above our heads might seem beautiful, but new research shows atmospheric rivers to be among the most damaging of weather systems. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/20/515838078/new-research-shows-how-atmospheric-rivers-wreak-havoc-around-the-globe

item.title: Can Poetry Keep You Young? Science Is Still Out, But The Heart Says Yes
item.description: February 20, 2017 - Scientific evidence showing health benefits from engaging in the arts is still weak. But Los Angeles students in their 80s say their poetry class gives them joy, solace, community and a voice.
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - Scientific evidence showing health benefits from engaging in the arts is still weak. But Los Angeles students in their 80s say their poetry class gives them joy, solace, community and a voice. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/20/514558968/can-poetry-keep-you-young-science-is-still-out-but-the-heart-says-yes

item.title: On Second Attempt, SpaceX Launches Rocket At NASA's Historic Pad
item.description: February 19, 2017 - SpaceX scrubbed a launch attempt Saturday at NASA's Launch Complex 39A, site of the shuttle program and the mission that first sent humans to the moon. Their second try succeeded Sunday.
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - SpaceX scrubbed a launch attempt Saturday at NASA's Launch Complex 39A, site of the shuttle program and the mission that first sent humans to the moon. Their second try succeeded Sunday. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/19/516082519/watch-live-all-systems-go-for-spacex-launch-at-nasas-historic-pad

item.title: Why NASA Is Exploring An Alien World In Antarctica
item.description: February 19, 2017 - Covered in ice and filled with bubbling lava, the Antarctic volcano Mount Erebus is the perfect proxy for an alien world. That's why NASA's Aaron Curtis travels there to test space exploration robots.
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - Covered in ice and filled with bubbling lava, the Antarctic volcano Mount Erebus is the perfect proxy for an alien world. That's why NASA's Aaron Curtis travels there to test space exploration robots. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/19/516064742/why-nasa-is-exploring-an-alien-world-in-antarctica

item.title: NASA Announces Winners In 'Space Poop Challenge'
item.description:
February 19, 2017 - Even astronauts have to go number two. NASA recently asked the public for suggestions on how to better deal with poop in spacesuits.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/02/19/516064679/nasa-announces-winners-in-space-poop-challenge
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - Even astronauts have to go number two. NASA recently asked the public for suggestions on how to better deal with poop in spacesuits. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/19/516064679/nasa-announces-winners-in-space-poop-challenge

item.title: Can Changing When And What We Eat Help Outwit Disease?
item.description: February 19, 2017 - I'm fasting intermittently as part of a research study, to see if changing my gut microbiome affects my multiple sclerosis. But maybe living on Peanut Chews isn't the best strategy.
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - I'm fasting intermittently as part of a research study, to see if changing my gut microbiome affects my multiple sclerosis. But maybe living on Peanut Chews isn't the best strategy. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/19/514179856/can-changing-when-and-what-we-eat-help-outwit-disease

item.title: Have Spare Time? Try To Discover A Planet
item.description: February 18, 2017 - Astronomers think there's an undiscovered planet lurking in the far reaches of the solar system, and they're asking the public's help to find it.
item.itunes:summary: February 18, 2017 - Astronomers think there's an undiscovered planet lurking in the far reaches of the solar system, and they're asking the public's help to find it. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/18/515810147/have-spare-time-try-to-discover-a-planet

item.title: A Liftoff Deferred: SpaceX Mission From NASA's Historic Launch Pad Delayed
item.description: February 18, 2017 - Launch Complex 39A, the site of the Apollo 11 mission, has quite a storied past. Now, it's on the brink of a new era — but it'll have to wait a bit, after Saturday's launch was scrubbed for 24 hours.
item.itunes:summary: February 18, 2017 - Launch Complex 39A, the site of the Apollo 11 mission, has quite a storied past. Now, it's on the brink of a new era — but it'll have to wait a bit, after Saturday's launch was scrubbed for 24 hours. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/18/515946936/watch-live-spacex-launch-marks-a-milestone-for-nasas-historic-pad

item.title: When Their Food Ran Out, These Reindeer Kept Digging
item.description: February 18, 2017 - Reindeer are thought to face a grim future as climate change threatens lichen, a key winter food source. But on one Alaskan island, reindeer have found a new food source, making scientists hopeful.
item.itunes:summary: February 18, 2017 - Reindeer are thought to face a grim future as climate change threatens lichen, a key winter food source. But on one Alaskan island, reindeer have found a new food source, making scientists hopeful. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/18/514523987/when-their-food-ran-out-these-reindeer-kept-digging

item.title: 'Are We Alone?' Churchill Concludes It's Likely Life Circles Other Suns
item.description: February 18, 2017 - In an essay written in 1939, Winston Churchill pondered the possibility that there might be life elsewhere in the universe. The document was recently rediscovered in a museum in Fulton, Mo.
item.itunes:summary: February 18, 2017 - In an essay written in 1939, Winston Churchill pondered the possibility that there might be life elsewhere in the universe. The document was recently rediscovered in a museum in Fulton, Mo. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/18/515863313/are-we-alone-churchill-concludes-its-likely-life-circles-other-suns

item.title: In Massachusetts, Coastal Residents Consider How To Adapt To Climate Change
item.description: February 17, 2017 - Living by the shore in the age of climate change means managing risk. In the community of Nahant, Mass., residents are trying to decide how to adapt.
item.itunes:summary: February 17, 2017 - Living by the shore in the age of climate change means managing risk. In the community of Nahant, Mass., residents are trying to decide how to adapt. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/17/515621902/in-massachusetts-coastal-residents-consider-how-to-adapt-to-climate-change

item.title: Senate Confirms Scott Pruitt To Lead Environmental Protection Agency
item.description: February 17, 2017 - Scott Pruitt is promising an aggressive rollback of regulations at the Environmental Protection Agency. NPR takes a look at what he's likely to target and the challenges he will face.
item.itunes:summary: February 17, 2017 - Scott Pruitt is promising an aggressive rollback of regulations at the Environmental Protection Agency. NPR takes a look at what he's likely to target and the challenges he will face. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/17/515841090/senate-confirms-scott-pruitt-to-lead-environmental-protection-agency
